Description: Tear shaped pottery weight with single drilled hole near the top. Made from a heavy imported fabric. Very worn suggesting some use. Coarse grey fabric with yellow-grey surface. Large white and black inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
May be either a fishing or a loom weight.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TF.07)
